title: How it feels to get into a game with a streamer

replies.body:
I played against brofresco once. It was an easy game. 
He should stick to getting carried by his high elo friends in customs.

Doesn't he play EU?
And doesn't he only play customs?

_Sick burn btw_
He's "gold" in eu. But if you ever watch his videos it hurts to watch him play XD. Only reason to do so is to see new content early (which he does a decent job of doing)

I can't stand his voice and mannerisms, so I always wait for some of the others (Redmercy) to make videos. Also [surrender@20](http://www.surrenderat20.net/) does a superb job of keeping up to date with everything.
Yeah but for me I like seeing it in game, being played. It helps somewhat to watch him (sometimes, other times I can't stand him) if only because it shows me what not to do XD
I had to lane against MagikarpUsedFly my first time playing Twisted fate. Fed my ass off. Had those amazing ult, blue card plays.

Literally every time I try to start learning Twisted Fate, I get stuck against something like Panth mid, feed a ton, get called boosted by my adc (it's _always_ the adc), and become too tilted to try him again for a long while.

As a TF main I can tell you most matchups are "How much shit am I willing to deal with in lane? Am I prepared to go even or lose without ganks? Are the other lanes safe to gank with my team?"if 2 out of the three last questions is answered with "No" playing TF is gonna be a bitch/not a good idea.

Unless you get ganks mid you're most likely going to have to rely on TP ganks, which is your specialty, but good jungle rotations and counter ganks can shut you down. It's usually fun and worth it, but the KILL LANES WILL END YOU!

{{champion:99}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:105}} {{champion:63}} 

These champions (and many others) make lane an incredibly difficult balance between Csing and feeding. Which is where the question "How much shit am I willing to deal with in lane?" comes in. These lane matchups are bad, but TF doesn't win his lane, he wins game. If you can put up with their shit you can do some great things for your team.

http://66.media.tumblr.com/c8f04cc217319ba55d3b1054bac5dc65/tumblr_o3fys4Vi921sdy2pwo1_500.gif

> you can do some great things for your team.

Like, yellow card...and that's it, that's the champion.

You also have an AOE slow that can open up more than one target to an engage from your team, wave clear to defend objectives, semi-reliable poke, and map pressure for your team that can help with securing other objectives.

But yes, the Gold Card is a major part of his kit that allows him to assist his team.

What I do is add nice players (not necessarily playing well, but just being a nice person) from matchmade games, and play with them if I know I'm gonna suck hard.
Or play with irl friends, but nobody who plays League has those.

I've been with people who claimed to be streamers and YouTubers of some sort or another but, FUNNILY ENOUGH, when they give me the link to their video channels, these games -never- get posted, mysteriously enough.

/sarcasm off

I once trolled this guy with an amateur gold jungling stream by playing Taric top (pre-rework) and he was playing Zac

Lets just say the enemy top got screwed over 

Then I supported this one-trick ADC TF (one of those gods of silver) who apparently had a stream where only 1 person watched and he somehow got super fed.

~~Close enough~~
Played with Meteos on my team vs Imaqtpie and Annie bot...this was when flex que first started and I somehow managed to get D5 in flex que, the same as my regular ranked que.  We got stomped :(
I played with and vs Anklespankin in a normal game, he's kinda boring to lane against....
